typeDescription: Model information for a reagent used in an experiment.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: Name of this Object.

fields.name: ID
fields.description: ID of this Object.

fields.name: Object
fields.description: Object of this Object.

metadata.value: The object reference of this object.

fields.name: Type
fields.description: Type of this Object.

fields.name: Notebook
fields.description: Notebook this object belongs to.

fields.name: Objects
fields.description: Objects that represent instances of this model.

fields.name: Synonyms
fields.description: List of possible alternative names this model goes by.

fields.name: Composition
fields.description: The molecular composition of this model.

Identity Model.value: Model[Molecule] | Model[Molecule, cDNA] | Model[Molecule, Oligomer] | Model[Molecule, Transcript] | Model[Molecule, Protein] | Model[Molecule, Protein, Antibody] | Model[Molecule, Carbohydrate] | Model[Molecule, Polymer] | Model[Resin] | Model[Resin, SolidPhaseSupport] | Model[Lysate] | Model[ProprietaryFormulation] | Model[Virus] | Model[Cell] | Model[Cell, Mammalian] | Model[Cell, Bacteria] | Model[Cell, Yeast] | Model[Tissue] | Model[Material] | Model[Species]

fields.name: OpticalComposition
fields.description: Describes the molar composition (in percent) of enantiomers, if this sample contains one of the enantiomers or is a mixture of enantiomers.

Identity Model.value: Model[Molecule] | Model[Molecule, cDNA] | Model[Molecule, Oligomer] | Model[Molecule, Transcript] | Model[Molecule, Protein] | Model[Molecule, Protein, Antibody] | Model[Molecule, Carbohydrate] | Model[Molecule, Polymer] | Model[Resin] | Model[Resin, SolidPhaseSupport] | Model[Lysate] | Model[ProprietaryFormulation] | Model[Virus] | Model[Cell] | Model[Cell, Mammalian] | Model[Cell, Bacteria] | Model[Cell, Yeast] | Model[Tissue] | Model[Material] | Model[Species]

fields.name: Solvent
fields.description: Describes the composition of the solvent of this model.

Component.value: Model[Molecule] | Model[Molecule, cDNA] | Model[Molecule, Oligomer] | Model[Molecule, Transcript] | Model[Molecule, Protein] | Model[Molecule, Protein, Antibody] | Model[Molecule, Carbohydrate] | Model[Molecule, Polymer] | Model[Resin] | Model[Resin, SolidPhaseSupport] | Model[Lysate] | Model[ProprietaryFormulation] | Model[Virus] | Model[Cell] | Model[Cell, Mammalian] | Model[Cell, Bacteria] | Model[Cell, Yeast] | Model[Tissue] | Model[Material] | Model[Species] | Model[Sample]

fields.name: UsedAsSolvent
fields.description: Indicates if this sample is used as a solvent.

fields.name: ConcentrationFactor
fields.description: The amount by which this the sample must be diluted with its Solvents in order to form standard ratio of Models for 1X buffer.

fields.name:
AlternativeStock
Concentrations
fields.description: The models that when diluted with their Solvents by ConcentrationFactor form equivalent 1X versions of the same buffer.

fields.name: Grade
fields.description: The purity of this model, encapsulating a set of purity standards for specific uses.

fields.name: AlternativeForms
fields.description: Models of other samples with different grades, hydration states, monobasic/dibasic forms, etc.

fields.name: Deprecated
fields.description: Indicates that this model is historical and no longer used in the ECL.

fields.name: Authors
fields.description: The people who created this model.

fields.name: Analytes
fields.description: The molecular identities of primary interest in this sample.

metadata.value: Model[Molecule] | Model[Molecule, cDNA] | Model[Molecule, Oligomer] | Model[Molecule, Transcript] | Model[Molecule, Protein] | Model[Molecule, Protein, Antibody] | Model[Molecule, Carbohydrate] | Model[Molecule, Polymer] | Model[Resin] | Model[Resin, SolidPhaseSupport] | Model[Lysate] | Model[ProprietaryFormulation] | Model[Virus] | Model[Cell] | Model[Cell, Mammalian] | Model[Cell, Bacteria] | Model[Cell, Yeast] | Model[Tissue] | Model[Material] | Model[Species]

fields.name: Tags
fields.description: User-supplied labels that are used for the management and organization of samples. If an aliquot is taken out of this sample, the new sample that is generated will inherit this sample's tags.

fields.name: UNII
fields.description: Unique Ingredient Identifier of compounds based on the unified identification scheme of FDA.

fields.name: Waste
fields.description: Indicates if samples of this model are a collection of other samples that are to be thrown out.

fields.name: WasteType
fields.description: Indicates the type of waste collected in this sample.

fields.name: State
fields.description: The physical state of the sample when well solvated at room temperature and pressure.

fields.name: SampleHandling
fields.description: The method by which this sample should be manipulated in the lab when transfers out of the sample are requested.

fields.name: CellType
fields.description: The primary types of cells that are contained within this sample.

fields.name: CultureAdhesion
fields.description: The default type of cell culture (adherent or suspension) that should be performed when growing these cells. If a cell line can be cultured via an adherent or suspension culture, this is set to the most common cell culture type for the cell line.

fields.name: ProductDocumentationFiles
fields.description: PDFs of any product documentation provided by the supplier of this model.

fields.name: MeltingPoint
fields.description: Melting temperature of the pure substance at atmospheric pressure.

fields.name: BoilingPoint
fields.description: Temperature at which the pure substance boils under atmospheric pressure.

fields.name: VaporPressure
fields.description: Vapor pressure of the substance at room temperature.

fields.name: Viscosity
fields.description: The viscosity of the substance in pure form at room temperature.

fields.name: RefractiveIndex
fields.description: The refractive index of the substance at 20 degree Celsius.

fields.name: pKa
fields.description: The logarithmic acid dissociation constants of the substance at room temperature.

fields.name: Density
fields.description: Known density of samples of this model at room temperature.

fields.name: ParticleWeight
fields.description: The weight of a single particle of the sample, if the sample is a powder.

fields.name: SurfaceTension
fields.description: The surface tension of the substance in pure form at room temperature.

fields.name: ExtinctionCoefficients
fields.description: A measure of how strongly this sample absorbs light at a particular wavelength.

fields.name: InitialConcentration
fields.description: The initial manufacturer concentration for samples of this model.

fields.name: InitialMassConcentration
fields.description: The initial manufacturer mass of the consitutent(s) divided by the volume of the mixture for samples of this model.

fields.name: pH
fields.description: The logarithmic concentration of hydrogen ions of the substance at room temperature.

fields.name: NominalParticleSize
fields.description: The manufacture designated size distribution of particles in the sample model.

fields.name: Conductivity
fields.description: The conductivity of the substance.

fields.name: Tablet
fields.description: Indicates if this model is in the form of a small disk or cylinder of compressed solid substance in a measured amount.

fields.name: TabletWeight
fields.description: The mean mass of a single tablet of this model.

fields.name: TabletWeightDistribution
fields.description: The distribution of the single tablet weights measured from multiple samplings.

fields.name: FixedAmounts
fields.description: The pre-measured amounts in which samples of this model are always stored.

fields.name: TransferOutSolventVolumes
fields.description: For each member of FixedAmounts, the amount of the dissolution solvent required to solvate the fixed amount component in this model.

fields.name: Resuspension
fields.description: Indicates if one of the components in the stock solution is a sample which can only be prepared by adding a solution to its original container to dissolve it. The dissolved sample can be optionally removed from the original container for other preparation steps.

fields.name: SingleUse
fields.description: Indicates if this model of sample must be used only once and then disposed of after use.

fields.name: NucleicAcidFree
fields.description: Indicates if this model of sample is tested to be not contaminated with DNA and RNA by the manufacturer.

fields.name: PyrogenFree
fields.description: Indicates if this model of sample is tested to be not contaminated with endotoxin by the manufacturer.

fields.name: ReversePipetting
fields.description: Indicates if reverse pipetting technique should be used when transferring this sample via pipette. It is recommended to set ReversePipetting->True if this sample foams or forms bubbles easily.

fields.name: Products
fields.description: Products ordering information for this model.

fields.name: KitProducts
fields.description: Products ordering information for this model if this model is part of one or more kits.

fields.name: MixedBatchProducts
fields.description: Products ordering information for this model if this model is part of one or more mixed batches.

fields.name: ServiceProviders
fields.description: Service companies that provide synthesis of this model as a service.

fields.name: Expires
fields.description: Indicates if samples of this model expire after a given amount of time.

fields.name: ShelfLife
fields.description: The length of time after DateCreated that samples of this model are recommended for use before they should be discarded.

fields.name: UnsealedShelfLife
fields.description: The length of time after DateUnsealed that samples of this model are recommended for use before they should be discarded.

fields.name: PreferredWashBin
fields.description: Indicates the recommended bin for dishwashing this container.

fields.name: LightSensitive
fields.description: Determines if the sample reacts or degrades in the presence of light and should be stored in the dark to avoid exposure.

fields.name: DefaultStorageCondition
fields.description: The condition in which samples of this model are stored when not in use by an experiment; this condition may be overridden by the specific storage condition of any given sample.

fields.name: TransportChilled
fields.description: Indicates if samples of this model should be refrigerated during transport when used in experiments.

fields.name: TransportWarmed
fields.description: The temperature that samples of this model should be incubated at while transported between instruments during experimentation.

fields.name: TransportCondition
fields.description: Specifies how the samples of this model should be transported when in use in the lab.

fields.name: TransferTemperature
fields.description: The temperature that samples of this model should be at before any transfers using this sample occur.

fields.name: ThawTemperature
fields.description: The default temperature that samples of this model should be thawed at before using in experimentation.

fields.name: ThawTime
fields.description: The default time that samples of this model should be thawed before using in experimentation. If the samples are still not thawed after this time, thawing will continue until the samples are fully thawed.

fields.name: MaxThawTime
fields.description: The default maximum time that samples of this model should be thawed before using in experimentation.

fields.name: ThawMixType
fields.description: The default style of motion used to mix samples of this model following thawing.

fields.name: ThawMixRate
fields.description: The default frequency of rotation the mixing instrument uses to mix samples of this model following thawing.

fields.name: ThawNumberOfMixes
fields.description: The default number of times samples of this model are mixed by inversion or pipetting up and down following thawing.

fields.name: PipettingMethod
fields.description: The pipetting parameters used to manipulate samples of this model; these parameters may be overridden by direct specification of pipetting parameters in manipulation primitives.

fields.name: Parafilm
fields.description: Indicates if containers that contain this sample model should have their covers sealed with parafilm by default.

fields.name: AluminumFoil
fields.description: Indicates if containers that contain this sample model should be wrapped in aluminum foil to protect the container contents from light by default.

fields.name: Dimensions
fields.description: The external dimensions of this model of container.

fields.name: ThawMixTime
fields.description: The default duration for which samples of this model are mixed following thawing.

fields.name: Sterile
fields.description: Indicates that this model of sample arrives sterile from the manufacturer.

fields.name: RNaseFree
fields.description: Indicates that this model of sample is free of any RNases.

fields.name: Radioactive
fields.description: Indicates if samples of this model emit substantial ionizing radiation.

fields.name: Ventilated
fields.description: Indicates if samples of this model must be handled in a ventilated enclosures.

fields.name: InertHandling
fields.description: Indicates if samples of this model must be handled in a glove box.

fields.name: BiosafetyHandling
fields.description: Indicates if samples of this model must be handled in a biosafety cabinet.

fields.name: GloveBoxIncompatible
fields.description: Indicates if samples of this model cannot be used inside of the glove box due high volatility and/or detrimental reactivity with the catalyst in the glove box that is used to remove traces of water and oxygen. Sulfur and sulfur compounds (such as H2S, RSH, COS, SO2, SO3), halides, halogen (Freon), alcohols, hydrazine, phosphene, arsine, arsenate, mercury, and saturation with water may deactivate the catalyst.

fields.name: GloveBoxBlowerIncompatible
fields.description: Indicates that the glove box blower must be turned off to prevent damage to the catalyst in the glove box that is used to remove traces of water and oxygen when manipulating samples of this model inside of the glove box.

fields.name: Flammable
fields.description: Indicates if samples of this model are easily set aflame under standard conditions.

fields.name: Acid
fields.description: Indicates if samples of this model are strong acids (pH <= 2) and require dedicated secondary containment during storage.

fields.name: Base
fields.description: Indicates if samples of this model are strong bases (pH >= 12) and require dedicated secondary containment during storage.

fields.name: Pyrophoric
fields.description: Indicates if samples of this model can ignite spontaneously upon exposure to air.

fields.name: WaterReactive
fields.description: Indicates if samples of this model react spontaneously upon exposure to water.

fields.name: Fuming
fields.description: Indicates if samples of this model emit fumes spontaneously when exposed to air.

fields.name: Aqueous
fields.description: Indicates if samples of this model are a solution in water.

fields.name: Anhydrous
fields.description: Indicates if samples of this model do not contain water.

fields.name: HazardousBan
fields.description: Indicates if samples of this model are currently banned from usage in the ECL because the facility isn't yet equiped to handle them.

fields.name: ExpirationHazard
fields.description: Indicates if samples of this model become hazardous once they are expired and therefore must be automatically disposed of when they pass their expiration date.

fields.name:
ParticularlyHazardous
Substance
fields.description: Indicates if special precautions should be taken in handling this substance as indicated by the MSDS classification.

fields.name: DrainDisposal
fields.description: Indicates if samples of this model may be safely disposed down a standard drain.

fields.name: Pungent
fields.description: Indicates if samples of this model have a strong odor.

fields.name: MSDSRequired
fields.description: Indicates if an MSDS is applicable for this model.

fields.name: MSDSFile
fields.description: PDF of the models MSDS (Materials Saftey Data Sheet).

fields.name: NFPA
fields.description: The National Fire Protection Association (NFPA) 704 hazard diamond classification for the substance.

fields.name: DOTHazardClass
fields.description: The Department of Transportation hazard classification of the substance.

fields.name: BiosafetyLevel
fields.description: The Biosafety classification of the substance.

fields.name: IncompatibleMaterials
fields.description: A list of materials that would be damaged if wetted by this model.

fields.name: WettedMaterials
fields.description: The materials of which this sample is made that may come in direct contact with fluids.

fields.name: LiquidHandlerIncompatible
fields.description: Indicates if this sample cannot be reliably aspirated or dispensed on an automated liquid handling robot.

fields.name: UltrasonicIncompatible
fields.description: Indicates if volume measurements of samples of this model cannot be performed via the ultrasonic distance method due to vapors interfering with the reading.

fields.name: PreferredMALDIMatrix
fields.description: The model of the matrix that is best suited for MALDI mass spectrometry of this sample.

fields.name: QualificationFrequency
fields.description: The model Qualifications and their required frequencies.

fields.name: MaintenanceFrequency
fields.description: The model maintenances and their required frequencies.

fields.name: ContinuousOperation
fields.description: Indicates if the sample is required to operate continuously in the lab, regardless of if it is InUse by a specific protocol.

fields.name: Protocols
fields.description: All protocols that used this sample at any point during their execution in the lab.

fields.name: ThawCellsMethod
fields.description: The default method by which to thaw cryovials of this sample model.

fields.name: WashCellsMethod
fields.description: The default method by which to wash cultures of this sample model.

fields.name: ChangeMediaMethod
fields.description: The default method by which to change the media for cultures of this sample model.

fields.name: Preparable
fields.description: Indicates if this samples/items of this model maybe prepared as needed during the course of an experiment.
